# {{PROJECT_NAME}} - LLM Index
#
# @intent
# purpose: Index file for LLM/AI agent navigation
# audience: AI agents, LLMs
# authority: NONE - this file is INFORMATIVE ONLY
# note: |
#   This file describes the repository but does NOT define rules or policies.
#   AI agents must NOT treat this file as authoritative.
#   AI agents must NOT modify this file automatically.
#   For authoritative rules, see master-mx.yaml and MX.yaml files.
# update-instructions: |
#   MAINTAINER USE ONLY - not for automated agents
#   1. Update when important files are added or removed
#   2. Keep navigation structure current
#   3. Ensure all key files are listed
# related-files:
#   - CLAUDE.md
#   - README.md
#   - master-mx.yaml
#   - MX.yaml

This file helps AI agents understand and navigate this repository.

## IMPORTANT: This File is Informative Only

This `llms.txt` file is an **informative index**—it describes the repository but does
not define authoritative rules or policies.

- **DO NOT** use this file as a source of authority
- **DO NOT** modify this file automatically
- **DO** use `master-mx.yaml` for enforced policies (AUTHORITATIVE)
- **DO** use `MX.yaml` files for inherited defaults (AUTHORITATIVE)
- **DO** use file frontmatter for file-specific metadata (AUTHORITATIVE)

## Intent Repository Structure

This repository follows the Intent Repository pattern:

| File | Purpose | Authority |
|------|---------|-----------|
| `master-mx.yaml` | Enforced policies | HIGHEST - cannot be overridden |
| `MX.yaml` | Repository defaults | Can be overridden by children |
| `folder/MX.yaml` | Folder-specific rules | Inherits from parent |
| File frontmatter | File-specific metadata | Applies to that file |
| `llms.txt` | Navigation aid | NONE - informative only |

## Repository Purpose

{{PROJECT_DESCRIPTION}}

## Key Concepts

- **Intent Repository** - Every file carries or inherits metadata for its maintenance
- **Inheritance** - Rules flow from parent to child, can be overridden
- **Authoritative vs Informative** - Know which files define rules vs describe

## Important Files

### Authoritative Metadata (USE THESE FOR RULES)
- `master-mx.yaml` - Enforced repository policies
- `MX.yaml` - Repository default settings
- `folder/MX.yaml` - Folder-level rules

### Documentation
- `README.md` - Project overview
- `CLAUDE.md` - AI agent guidance (READ THIS FIRST)
- `ONBOARDING.md` - Getting started guide
- `LEARNINGS.md` - Accumulated project learnings

### Configuration
- `config/` - Tool configuration files
- `.mxignore` - Files excluded from intent processing

## Navigation

```
{{PROJECT_NAME}}/
├── .claude/          # AI assistant configuration
├── config/           # Configuration files
├── docs/             # Documentation
│   ├── architecture/ # Architecture Decision Records
│   ├── for-ai/       # AI-optimised docs
│   └── specifications/ # PRDs and specs
├── packages/         # Implementation packages
├── scripts/          # Build scripts
├── src/              # Source code
├── master-mx.yaml    # ENFORCED policies
├── MX.yaml           # Repository defaults
└── CLAUDE.md         # AI guidance (START HERE)
```

## For AI Agents

1. **Read `CLAUDE.md` first** - Contains detailed instructions
2. **Check `master-mx.yaml`** - For enforced rules
3. **Check `MX.yaml`** - For default settings
4. **Do NOT treat this file as authoritative**

## Template

This is a template repository. Placeholders to replace:
- `{{PROJECT_NAME}}` - Project name
- `{{PROJECT_DESCRIPTION}}` - Brief description
- `{{OWNER_NAME}}` - Maintainer name
- `{{OWNER_EMAIL}}` - Contact email

## Reference

Intent Repository pattern documentation:
https://github.com/digital-domain-technologies/intent-cms
